org.metacsp.framework

Class ConstraintNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.metacsp.framework.ConstraintNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullConstraintNetwork

    public class ConstraintNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    This class implements the necessary functionality to maintain networks of Constraints. It is used by all ConstraintSolvers and provides methods to add and remove Variables, Constraints, querying the network for constraints, incident edges, etc. It also provide basic graphical rendering functions.
    Author:
    Federico Pecora
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConstraintNetwork

        public ConstraintNetwork(ConstraintSolver sol)
        Instantiates a new ConstraintNetwork. Note that all implementing classes must call this constructor (i.e., specifying a ConstraintSolver is mandatory).
        Parameters:
        sol - The ConstraintSolver which maintains this ConstraintNetwork.

    • Method Detail

      • addSubstitution

        public void addSubstitution(VariablePrototype vp,
                   Variable v)
        Convenience method to keep track of correspondences between VariablePrototypes and Variables (useful when ConstraintNetworks are used as meta-values in MetaConstraintSolvers).
        Parameters:
        vp - The VariablePrototype.
        v - The Variable that corresponds to the given VariablePrototype.

      • getSubstitution

        public Variable getSubstitution(VariablePrototype vp)
        Get the Variable corresponding to a given VariablePrototype (see addSubstitution() method).
        Parameters:
        vp - The VariablePrototype to look up.
        Returns:
        The Variable corresponding to the given VariablePrototype.

      • getConstraint

        public Constraint getConstraint(Variable from,
                       Variable to)
        Returns the Constraint between two given Variables (if it exists). If more than one exists, it returns one of them (no guarantees as to which one).
        Parameters:
        from - The source variable of the Constraint to find.
        to - The destination variable of the Constraint to find.
        Returns:
        The Constraint between the two given Variables, null if no such Constraint exists.

      • getConstraints

        public Constraint[] getConstraints(Variable from,
                          Variable to)
        Returns all Constraints between two given Variables.
        Parameters:
        from - The source variable of the Constraints to find.
        to - The destination variable of the Constraints to find.
        Returns:
        All Constraints between the two given Variables, null if no such Constraint exists.

        public void addVariable(Variable v)
        Adds a given Variable to the network.
        Parameters:

        public void removeVariable(Variable v)
        Removes a given Variable from the network.
        Parameters:
        v - The Variable to remove from the network.

      • addConstraint

        public void addConstraint(Constraint c)
        Adds a Constraint to the network.
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint to add to the network. NOTE: this only works for BinaryConstraints and MultiBinaryConstraints in the current implementation.

      • removeConstraint

        public void removeConstraint(Constraint c)
        Removes a given Constraint from the network.
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint to remove from the network.

      • getVariableFrom

        public Variable getVariableFrom(Constraint c)
        Gets the source Variable of a given (binary) Constraint.
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint from which to get the source Variable.
        Returns:
        The source Variable of the given Constraint.

      • getVariableTo

        public Variable getVariableTo(Constraint c)
        Gets the destination Variable of a given (binary) Constraint.
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint from which to get the destination Variable.
        Returns:
        The destination Variable of the given Constraint.

      • getVariable

        public Variable getVariable(int id)
        Gets a Variable given its ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Variable.
        Returns:
        The Variable with the given ID (if it exists).

      • checkDomainsInstantiated

        public Variable checkDomainsInstantiated()
        Checks whether the domains of the Variables in the ConstraintNetwork are instantiated. This is used by the ConstraintSolver class to assess whether automatic propagation should occur (in some CSPs, domains of Variables cannot be instantiated by the Variable constructor, rather an explicit call to a dedicated method is necessary).
        Returns:
        null if all domains are instantiated; a Variable whose domain is not instantiated if one exists.

      • draw

        public static void draw(ConstraintNetwork cn,
        java.lang.String title)
        A static method for drawing ConstraintNetworks. This method is static so that it can be called to draw an object of a subclass (Java enforces late-binding). This method instantiated a JFrame containing a rendering of the ConstraintNetwork. The rendering is dynamic and attempts to animate transitions when Constraint and/or Variables are added/removed from the network.
        Parameters:
        cn - The ConstraintNetwork to draw.
        title - The title of the JFrame containing the rendered ConstraintNetwork.

      • draw

        public static void draw(ConstraintNetwork cn,
        java.lang.String title,
        Callback cb)
        A static method for drawing ConstraintNetworks. This method is static so that it can be called to draw an object of a subclass (Java enforces late-binding). This method instantiated a JFrame containing a rendering of the ConstraintNetwork. The rendering is dynamic and attempts to animate transitions when Constraint and/or Variables are added/removed from the network.
        Parameters:
        cn - The ConstraintNetwork to draw.
        title - The title of the JFrame containing the rendered ConstraintNetwork.
        cb - A Callback object to use when the button is pressed.

      • draw

        public static void draw(ConstraintNetwork cn)
        Same as the static two-argument draw method, using the ConstraintNetwork's simple class name as the title of the JFrame.
        Parameters:
        cn - The ConstraintNetwork to draw.

      • getEdgeLabel

        public java.lang.String getEdgeLabel()
        Get a String representation of this ConstraintNetwork (note that MetaConstraintSolvers use ConstraintNetworks as resolvers, therefore this method is used to draw the edge label in the search tree rendering).
        Returns:
        A String representation of this Constraint.
